description: Triangle of coefficients in expansion of (x-1)(x-3)(x-5)...(x-(2n-1)).
comments: Triangle of B-analogs of Stirling numbers of first kind.
links: R. Suter, Two analogues of a classical sequence, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 3 (2000), #P00.1.8.
formula: Triangle T(n, k), read by rows, given by [ -1, -2, -3, -4, -5, -6, -7, ...] DELTA [1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, ...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938 . - _Philippe Deléham_, Feb 20 2005a(n,m) = a(n-1,m-1)-(2*n-1)*a(n-1,m) with a(n,0) = (-1)^n*(2*n-1)!! and a(n,n) = 1. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 08 2009Exponential Riordan array [1/sqrt(1+2*x),1/2*log(1+2*x)] with e.g.f. (1+2*x)^((t-1)/2) = 1 + (t-1)*x + (t-1)*(t-3)*x^2/2! + .... - _Peter Bala_, Jun 23 2014
maple: nmax:=8; mmax:=nmax: for n from 0 to nmax do a(n, 0) := (-1)^n*doublefactorial(2*n-1) od: for n from 0 to nmax do a(n, n) := 1 od: for n from 2 to nmax do for m from 1 to n-1 do a(n, m) := a(n-1, m-1)-(2*n-1)*a(n-1, m) od; od: seq(seq(a(n, m), m=0..n), n=0..nmax); # [_Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 08 2009, revised Nov 29 2012]
mathematica: a[n_, m_] := a[n, m] = a[n-1, m-1] - (2*n-1)*a[n-1, m]; a[n_, 0] := (-1)^n*(2*n-1)!!; a[n_, n_] = 1; Table[a[n, m], {n, 0, 9}, {m, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 16 2012, after _Johannes W. Meijer_ *)
crossrefs: A161198 is an unsigned scaled triangle version.
A109692 is an unsigned transposed triangle version.
author: Ruedi Suter (suter(AT)math.ethz.ch)
